results.title: The Crying game
results.creator_credit: Neil Jordan, Stephen Woolley, Nippon Film Development & Finance, Euro Trustees, Channel Four and Palace Films
results.brief_description: Full of surprises, this film did more than win extraordinary critical acclaim throughout the world. It upstaged the competition by receiving six Academy Award nominations and an Oscar for Best Screenplay. Set in Ireland, this spellbinding thriller involves a black British soldier, Jody (Forest Whittaker), who befriends his reluctant IRA captor, Fergus (Stephen Rea). When Jody is killed in an ambush, Fergus fulfills his dying wish - to find his girlfriend Dil (Jaye Davidson) in England. When Fergus and Dil become romantically involved, the crying game begins. Electrifying and seductive, this is the movie that had everyone talking. Also stars Miranda Richardson.

results.title: The Cry of the gull
results.creator_credit: David Fulton, Gloria Montero, National Film Board of Canada and Montero-Fulton Productions
results.brief_description: The health and vitality of the gull reflect the “health” of the Great Lakes. When the gull population diminishes, biologists hasten to discover the reasons. The herring gull on Lake Ontario is in trouble, and so is the water. This film sounds a warning about the pollutants that are being pumped into these waters daily.

results.title: The Crossing
results.creator_credit: Daniel McCabe, Zvi Dor-Ner and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Columbus and the age of discovery”.
This episode takes us sailing in Columbus’ wake, a journey recreating his world to better understand our own. Travelling in the recreation of Columbus’ ships, the “Santa Maria”, the “Nina” and the “Pinta”, the modern crew duplicate the original preparations for the voyage in Palos de la Frontera in Spain, then follow Columbus’ route south to the Canary Islands (where he may have had a romantic interlude with the female governor!) and westward across the Atlantic. Although the ships, navigation and shipboard routines were all duplicated by the modern crew, they could not possibly recreate the anxiety suffered by the original crew sailing into the unknown, nor the relief experienced when land was finally sighted.

results.title: The Cows of Sudan
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Mary Hoth
results.brief_description: Nayaluak Beche recounts her farming life in Sudan where the women milk the cows and the men farm the land. She describes the cultures and traditions of women growing up in Sudan, her marriage and subsequent children and grandchildren and her decision to finally leave her homeland to join her daughter in Australia.

results.title: The Cruise
results.creator_credit: Faith Hubley, John Hubley, Joseph Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: An animated film by John and Faith Hubley in which everything moves to music and where a juke box is the center of everything. It is a fable of our times, about people and numbers and chance, set on a cruise ship where everything is most correct until a maverick passenger decides to flout the rules. Animation by Phil Duncan, Gary Mooney and Les Drew. Music by Benny Carter.

results.title: Columbus' world
results.creator_credit: Stephen Segaller, Thomas Friedman and WGBH (Boston)
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Columbus and the age of discovery”.
Why did it have to be Christopher Columbus who discovered the “New World”? What was it about his personality and the time in which he lived that conspired to change the course of history? In this, the first episode of a series made to celebrate the 500th anniversary of Columbus’ discoveries, the trading practices of the civilised world at the time of Columbus are extensively outlined to explain why this ambitious and determined son of a Genoese wool-weaver, inspired by the earlier travels of Marco Polo, set off into the unknown, lured by the promise of the gold, silk and spices of the Orient.

results.title: Dancing again
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Hannan Kuea
results.brief_description: Hannan Kuea reminisces about her childhood and life in Sudan and especially her wedding day - this very special day to be the last of the families getting together in Sudan before the married couple move on to Kenya and finally to Australia. On this wedding day the families (one side from North Sudan, the other from South Sudan) danced their traditional tribal dances in celebration. It would be many years later before the families reunite to dance once again in their new land on the other side of the world.

results.title: The Crucible
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Hytner, David V. Picker, Robert Miller and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: She afflicts me! She comes to me at night and torments me! She’s a witch! In the Puritan village of Salem Massachusetts in 1692, these words provoked fear and terror in the hearts of the townspeople. Behind these accusations lie the covenance of a neighbours land and a girl who will stop at nothing to capture the heart of a married man. This screenplay is penned by Arthur Miller and based on his play of the same name. He skillfully recreates a real-life story, combining intrigue, romance and suspense of the infamous Salem Witch Trials. Cast includes Daniel Day-Lewis, Winona Ryder, Paul Scofield, Joan Allen, Bruce Davidson, Rob Campbell and Jeffrey Jones. A study guide accompanies this tape.

results.title: A Chronic problem
results.creator_credit: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “A Discussion in bioethics”.
One of a series of short, open-ended dramas designed to stimulate discussion of values and ethics in relation to modern medical technology. This film considers the chronic patient’s right to quality care, and the acutely ill patient’s right to a hospital bed. Jean is suffering from multiple sclerosis and is almost completely paralyzed. It seems that the only ones who care about her are the nurses. With the arrival of a patient in need of an operation, it becomes apparent that chronic patients have little priority.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Cynthia Scott, Wolf Koenig, Andy Thomson and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: My grandmother
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Elizabeth Leek
results.brief_description: Elizabeth lived with her grandmother in a little village in Sudan. This story is a dedication to her grandmother, a woman who taught her many things.
